name: Watershed Development & Roads / Infrastructure
functionStatement: Runoff and infiltration sustain natural flow regime, carry appropriate sediment and nutrients from uplands, and reliably cue spawning/migration of aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: "Road/trail proximity or density as an indicator of watershed development and potential sediment/pollutant delivery. Distance from the project reach to the nearest road and/or planned road expansion. Closer roads can increase stormwater inputs, constrain floodplains, and contribute sediment and pollutants. Road density within the contributing watershed or buffer. Higher road density can increase runoff, fragment riparian areas, and deliver sediment/pollutants. Degree of land development/disturbance in the watershed and/or near the project reach (e.g., urban areas, industrial sites, oil/gas, mining, timber harvest). Increased development can alter runoff, sediment delivery, and water quality."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed

Method: Desktop (GIS/imagery and existing datasets)
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Use roads/trails GIS and recent imagery to summarize proximity and/or density within the watershed or specified buffer. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Measure the minimum distance from the project reach (or riparian buffer) to mapped roads using GIS and/or recent imagery. Where specified, incorporate information on proposed road expansion. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Using a roads GIS layer, calculate total road length divided by watershed area (or within the specified buffer). Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Review recent imagery and available land use/permit data to characterize development intensity in the watershed and within the specified distance of the project reach (e.g., 1 mile). Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric."

inputs.label: Watershed Development & Roads / Infrastructure
inputs.helpMarkdown: "Roads/trails GIS (TIGER/Line/OSM/state datasets); recent aerial imagery. Roads GIS and DOT planning layers (if applicable); recent aerial imagery. USACE and other Permits Roads GIS (e.g., TIGER/Line, state DOT, or OpenStreetMap); watershed boundary. Imagery & Spatial data Imagery & NLCD Recent aerial imagery (e.g., NAIP); land cover/land use datasets (e.g., NLCD); permit/industry GIS layers (if available)."

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: No development or no potential for impacts. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Moderate development or moderate potential for impacts, but none within 1 mile of project reach. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: High development or potential for impacts in contributing watershed or within 1 mile of project reach, or high potential of impacts >1 mile away from project reach. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
